title: Strictly's David James snaps at Claudia Winkleman as mum gets shown
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

David James wasn’t too impressed when the BBC filmed his mum in the Strictly Come Dancing audience over the weekend.

The former footballer, who was sent home along with his partner Nadiya Bychkova during last night’s result show, snapped at presenter Claudia Winkleman as cameras cut to her after he performed his jive to Such a Night by Michael Bublé.

Before Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse, Shirley Ballas and Alfonso Ribeiro gave their points, David caught up with Claudia for a chat where he admitted that he didn’t feel he had made any mistakes with the routine.

‘We also have to mention that your mum is in the audience,’ the hostess pointed out.

However, David didn’t appreciate Claudia drawing attention to his mum and made it clear that she doesn’t like being in the spotlight.

‘Yeah, my mum doesn’t like cameras and she’s on the camera, thanks for that,’ David replied. ‘Hi mum.’

Awkward.

The cameras panned to David’s mum (Picture: BBC)

David told Claudia that his mum doesn’t like being filmed (Picture: BBC)

Claudia quickly apologised for the mishap, telling him: ‘Sorry, sorry,’ before then going to the judges for their scores.

To make matters worse, David found himself at the bottom of the leaderboard too, with the panel awarding him just 16 points for his performance with Nadiya.

David faced the dreaded dance-off on Sunday and competed against Mike Bushell for a place in the competition.

Sadly though, the judges unanimously voted to save Mike and sent the sportstar packing.

Speaking about his journey, David said: ‘Oh I’ve loved it. I feel so bad I’ve let Nadiya down in a sense. I’ve enjoyed it but I’ve put some weight on though.’

When asked about his highlights, the sports star added: ‘Having the best partner and the guys up there. Everyone’s lovely.’

Nadiya also sang David’s praises, telling him: ‘He’s done so well. I’m so proud of you. From the first day he couldn’t lift his elbows up or stand straight and now he’s delivered such an amazing jive. I’m so proud.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday at 6.35pm on BBC One.
